resources.string: Really erase your saved game? All of your progress/Settings will be lost!
Disabling sound may improve performance on some devices.
Adjusts the volume of Sound Effects of Game
Disabling music may improve performance on some devices.
Adjusts the volume of BackGround Music of Game
Enables safety hacks for broken devices (Cliq, etc), but causes some visual artifacts. Try this if you have problems.
Use the trackball click or directional pad center button to attack.
Displays movement pad and buttons on screen. Suggested for devices without a d-pad or trackball. Requires mulitouch.
EXPERIMENTAL! Tilt the phone left and right to drive the Android around. Good for devices with no trackball or d-pad.
Adjusts the sensitivity of the trackball, d-pad, or optical sensor.
Adjusts the sensitivity of the tilt controls.
Customize keys for phones with hard keyboards.
Sends anonymous play statistics to a server to help us make this game more fun.
Super Mario is android remake of famous Nintendo\'s Mario Brothers and is developed by Mahesh Kurmi (a hobiest Programmer), Aman Gupta(Student of IITD), Nitin Kukreja(A Student of NIT Trichi).
Go to the Super Mario web site

Special Thanks to meatfighter.com (for assets and base of game),Softendo.com(levels of game are taken from SuperMario Forever) Chris Pruett and Genki Mine (for Replica Island Source), Nintendo, and the Android Team for their support of this project.
Portions of this game are modifications based on work created and shared by Google and some open source projects under gnu Licence.
Output various logs to logcat. This option will slow the game down.
You can now access Linear Mode and the Level Select from the Extras menu!
Starting a new game in this mode will erase your current game in progress. Are you sure you want to start a new game?
This extra feature is still locked. Beat the game one time to unlock it!

Thanks for downloading Super Mario. Over 1.5 million people have played Super Mario !

 New in this version:
 - Unlockable extra modes: Linear Story Mode and Level Select.
 - On-screen controls for devices with no buttons.
 - Difficulty settings for new games. 
 - Play statistics shown when you finish the game.
 - Lots of bugs fixed!
 
 
 This is an open source project. If you are interested in how it works, or would like to use it to make your own games, check out the source at our web site, ....... 
 
 Also note that this game sends anonymous play statistics back to a server. If youâ€™d rather not allow that, you can turn it off in the options screen.

Based on your device hardware, the following control scheme has been automatically selected:

%1s

Super Mario supports many different control configurations. Control options can be changed at any time using the Configure Controls button in Options.

Are you ok with the control system selected above, or would you like to set up your control settings manually now?
Trackball / Trackpad - Sensitivity can be adjusted in Options.
Keyboard / Pad - Key mappings can be changed in Options.
Tilt - Sensitivity can be adjusted in Options.

This version of Super Mario adds an option for On-Screen Controls for multi-touch devices. Your device supports this new mode, but your options are currently set to Tilt controls. Would you like to try the new On-Screen Controls instead, or stick with Tilt? \nYou can change this setting at any time by choosing Configure Controls under Options.
